data.title: Ok chain
data.text: Have dined here in the past, restaurant is ok, seems like portion sizes have diminished overtime, staff is very friendly and attentive.  Food is just ok nothing spectacular.

data.title: Good value and friendly service
data.text: The prices are consistently great. Their "Perfect Margarita" really IS perfect. Blood Orange is my favorite. The staff are always perky and upbeat! My favorite dish is their Oriental Chicken Salad, but they make all their cuisine pop!

data.title: Good Service, Cheap Prices
data.text: I mean, it's Applebee's, you know what to expect.  Prices were very reasonable, our waitress was helpful and offered great service.  Food arrived quickly.  The place was busy.  I wish the menu descriptions were a little more descriptive, like it didn't mention the Sriracha Shrimp was breaded, but other than that, all was good.

data.title: Rainy Night Visit
data.text: We arrived around 8PM on a rainy summer night.  We were quickly seated in the bar area.  I forget the waiter's name, but he was friendly.  I tried something he recommended which was better than I would have expected.

data.title: Don't set your sights too high
data.text:
I actually enjoy Applebee's and they tend to be our go-to place when we crave basic American comfort food. I decided to try their new dish butchers meat and potatoes.  The picture sold me. Saliva glands started watering imaging the taste. When the order arrived, I'm sure my facial expression dropped a few notches.  This wasn't quite like the image saved in my brain.  I thought at the very least,  I was going to get the extra treat of great tasting and crispy onion rings on top. The photos I've attached should speak for themselves.  
I never like causing a scene so I rarely send anything back. I just won't order this dish again.  There were about 8 chunks of steak on my plate and 4 of them were basically gristle.  I Actually had to spit them out as I got tired of chewing.

data.title: Great service and the food was good, too!
data.text: This is only the third Applebee's i've ever eaten at and that only because we were meeting friends.  However, this time it was great!  The seating area was spacious so that you didn't feel crowded, it wasn't noisy, so we could easilty visit, and the food was good, but the service was attentive and great.  I would actually recommend this particular Applebee's.

data.title: Fabulous Applebee's
data.text: What a nice surprise!  We sat at the "rail" (Spokane speak for the bar!) and had a great time. Staff was cordial, funny & friendly. Just a truly enjoyable night out. Great draft beer, good food. Hadn't been to an Applebee's in ages and we were pleasantly surprised.

data.title: Enjoying dinner
data.text: Love going to Applebee's for dinner, they have a great choice and the food is always good. We love there two for $20.00 or $25.00 dinners. As you both can have what you like plus a salad or appetizer with your meal. And they alway have something new on there meal to try, good job Applebee's !

data.title: Mediocre Chain..this one pretty average
data.text: Family group stopped for lunch.  I ordered a lunch special that advertised 4 cheese mac and cheese with a sandwich.  Sorry, but the cheese were MIA--maybe their day off?  Pretty dry mac and cheese, though the bit of chicken and bacon did add a bit of flair.  The sandwich was OK, nothing special.  Used to love this chain, but it has lost its mojo the last decade.  Kids' chicken tenders were very Micky D like--that ain't a compliment--and the salads for the other two members were OK, nothing great.

data.title: Better than expected food and service!
data.text: Walking distance from my hotel. One thing I like about Applebee's is the constantly evolving menu. I had a cold beer and a steak dish that was excellent. And the server was very good too. I know it's popular to knock chain restaurants, but I travel a lot, and sometimes you just want a great meal in a familiar place. I will return to this Applebee's.

data.title: Awesome Dinner with a family of 14!
data.text: We had a family dinner at this Applebee's...it was Awesome!  This Applebee's is within walking distance from the Comfort Inn-Spokane Valley!  The Service and Food were Outstanding!  We will be repeat customers as we stay at the Comfort Inn.

data.title: Always 2 for $20,
data.text: I always enjoy Applebee's especially after a busy week.  I know the food is consistent and the service is friendly.  I'm always eager to go!

data.title: 2 for $20 fabulous
data.text:
Slight wait on service after reaching table.  Establishment not busy at the time.  However, staff was attentive and personable, once we were served.
Food was excellent.

data.title: Great salads
data.text:
Just had lunch here yesterday with a friend and I forgot how good it is.

The menu seems a little pared down for lunch options, but if you enjoy a variety of salads it would be a good great spot to stop.  

My friend had the summer watermelon shrimp salad and I stayed with my favorite the oriental chicken salad.   Very fresh ingredients.  Drinks are overpriced so be careful, it would not be a stop for drinks they are expensive.  I had a peach sangria and it was almost as much as my salad.

data.title: Walking distance from Valley Hospital, good food, friendly service
data.text: We go here 4 or 5 times a year and consider it an old standby. We can count on good service, a nice menu to choose from, and tasty food. They have items marked for those concerned with calories, too. We often have a steak dinner or an entree salad. The happy hour is a fun time to meet with friends.

data.title: This location flatters the chain
data.text: Just south of Interstate 90, this iteration of the Applebee's chain ranks with the best we've visited in the Pacific Northwest. The food was good, the service excellent and the restaurant seemed close to spotless. It also features ample parking with easy access not only to the freeway but major streets in the heart of the Spokane Valley.

data.title: Good Time
data.text: Ate here recently for my son's birthday celebration.  The food was good and the wait staff was terrific.  It was busy in the restaurant, but you could not tell that by the service.  The food was fast and the staff was very friendly.

data.title: 30 minutes before closing
data.text: My sister and I stopped in to get something to eat at 11:30 PM on a Wednesday night with a scheduled closing of midnight. The staff was great and we didn't feel rushed to eat our late dinner.

data.title: We were impressed!
data.text: We don't normally go to Applebee's, but this one was in walking distance of our motel. For some reason this one wasn't loud and noise like some of the other ones we have been in. The staff was great also. The manager was very attentive and showed concern for everyone. Thank you, we will return.

data.title: They do not have an oven!
data.text: The service here is always spot on, my review in no way reflects on the people who work here.  Applebee's is the worst period.  I have a friend who works here and he explained to me that they do not have an oven.  Applebee's instead uses a industrial microwave to cook EVERYTHING.  Steaks get defrosted and thrown into the microwave, if you do not believe me just ask your waiter.  I came here a couple weeks ago and ordered a half sandwich and a chicken caesar salad.  Probably the most pathetic salad I have ever seen.  About 75% of the salad had no dressing on it and the amount of chicken they gave you is little to none.  I ate only about half the salad and the waitress said, "looks like you just ate the good stuff" yes i did because no one likes eating room temperature dry lettuce except my turtle.  The half sandwich I had was room temperature and tasted way to sweet.  There are a million other places in the Valley to eat, DO NOT EAT HERE.
